name: sweet corn production | sweet corn | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15681/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of sweet corn. The average yield from 2006 is 17.8 t/ha. The data are representative for sweet corn production in Hungary from Soroksar, southern part of Budapest. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 223-23-143 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 4.35 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of sweet corn produced in the Hungary amounts to 21% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing sweet corn produced in the Hungary for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.3 (i.e. good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends with the harvest of sweet corn at farm gate. The dataset includes all machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, pesticide application, harvesting, and on-farm transport. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period referring to the data source: 2006-2006. Based on expert opinion data is considered to be valid at least up to 2012.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country;L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L3; Pesticides: L1; Machinery: L4; Irrigation: L2. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'sweet corn' is calculated to be circa 2.20E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.39E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

flow.name: Ammonia
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
The exchange has been updated from 'ammonium nitrate, as N' into 'ammonium nitrate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0044 kg by 2.8573 kg of 'ammonium nitrate' per kg of 'ammonium nitrate, as N'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Orosz et al. 2009) multiplied by the country-share of fertiliser type (IFA 2014). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 78.1 kg/ha

exchanges.description: This represent the transport of fertilizers that are directly linked to their supplying activities, to better represent the fertilizer mix of the activity. Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of sweet corn is calculated to be circa 2.44E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'atrazine', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.88E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
